titles.title: Sources of nitrogen and methane in Central American geothermal settings: Noble gas and 129I evidence for crustal and magmatic volatile components

rightsList.rights: Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-Share Alike 3.0 United States [CC BY-NC-SA 3.0]

descriptions.description: Gases and fluids from four geothermal fields of Central America were analyzed for nitrogen, methane, and helium concentrations, isotopic composition, and 129I/I ratios in order to determine the sources of volatiles in these systems. The magmatic flux of nitrogen and noble gases in Central America was then extrapolated to determine the degree of nitrogen recycling in island arc systems. Also contains gas data from Snyder et al 2001.
Volvanic gas, volatiles, nitrogen flux, noble gases, Iodide, Iodide 129, isotopes, methane, helium, geothermal, suduction zone, volcanic arc

geoLocation.geoLocationPlace: Central America, El Salvador, Nicaragua, Costa Rica, San Vicente, Miravalles, Momotombo, Chinameca
